titleproper.value: Guide to the Albert W. Ferris Papers <num>MC.183</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-11-28T15:51:25</date>

abstract.value: Albert W. Ferris was the grandson of New York University(NYU) Chancellor Isaac Ferris and an 1878 NYU alumnus.  The younger Ferris became a respected physician and psychiatrist in New York, as well as president of the NYU Alumni Association.  His notebooks provide a glimpse into the academic and social life of students at the University of the City of New York, as NYU was called during his time as a student.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Albert W. Ferris Papers; MC 183; box number; folder number; New York University Archives
Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown.

1. Ferris family file; Biographical files; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
2. "Dr. A.W. Ferris, 80, Insanity Expert." New York Times 5 Oct. 1937: 25. ProQuest Historical Newspapers. Web. 14 Oct. 2013.
3. Ferris, Albert W., M.D. "The State of New York Develops an American Spa." The Modern Hospital Dec. 1915: 397-99. Scholars Portal. Ontario Council of University Libraries. Web. 5 Oct. 2013.
4."$1,000 for Scholarship." New York Times 4 June 1905: n. pag. The New York Times. Web. 5 Oct. 2013.

The Albert W. Ferris Papers consist of notebooks related to NYU fraternities during the late nineteenth century.  The collection chronicles Ferris' time as a student at NYU, in particular his involvement in Phi Beta Kappa, Delta Upsilon, and Psi Upsilon. Notebooks list fraternity member honors, senior class presidents, and faculty reports.

corpname.value: Phi Beta Kappa. Beta of New York (New York University)
